qas.question: How many years was Hoover the FBI director?
What laboratory was Hoover responsible for creating?
What was the other name for the Scientific Crime Detection Laboratory?
When did the FBI laboratory open?
Who served as FBI director before 1924?
What year did the FBI laboratory officially close?
What laboratory was Hoover responsible for destroying?
What was the tenure limit for FBI directors before Hoover's death?
What passed legislation to set the tenure limit of CIA directors to ten years?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>J. Edgar Hoover<b5_0/><a0_0/> served as Director from 1924 to 1972, a combined <a1_0>48<a1_0/> years with the BOI, DOI, and FBI. He was chiefly responsible for creating the <a2_0><b7_0>Scientific Crime Detection Laboratory<b7_0/><a2_0/>, or the <a3_0>FBI Laboratory<a3_0/>, which officially opened in <a4_0><b6_0>1932<b6_0/><a4_0/>, as part of his work to professionalize investigations by the government. Hoover was substantially involved in most major cases and projects that the FBI handled during his tenure. After Hoover's death, <b9_0>Congress<b9_0/> passed legislation that limited the tenure of future FBI Directors to <b8_0>ten years<b8_0/>.
